paper_metadata.title: Economic Impact of International Fund for Agricultural Development-Value Chain Development Programme (IFAD-VCDP) on Rice Farmers in North Central Zone, Nigeria

program_information.program_name: International Fund for Agricultural Development-Value Chain Development Programme (IFAD-VCDP)

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Data obtained show a positive trend in net farm income per hectare, increasing from N390, 897.90 to N686, 652.91 before and after IFAD-VCDP intervention respectively. Before IFAD-VCDP intervention, 41.95% of the respondents were food-secured, improving to 61.43% after intervention. Poverty status of the respondents decreased from 50.5% before IFAD-VCDP to 43.8% after the programme intervention
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: The study assessed the economic impact of International Fund for Agricultural Development-Value Chain Development Programme (IFAD-VCDP) on rice farmers in North Central Zone, Nigeria using appropriate standard techniques with a well structured questionnaire

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: The study assessed the economic impact of International Fund for Agricultural Development-Value Chain Development Programme (IFAD-VCDP) on rice farmers in North Central Zone, Nigeria
evidence_citations.country_citation: The study area was North Central Zone, Nigeria
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The study assessed the economic impact of International Fund for Agricultural Development-Value Chain Development Programme (IFAD-VCDP) on rice farmers in North Central Zone, Nigeria
